thread.title: SAMMY winner, trumpet player Nick Frenay to perform with Josh Groban
thread.title_full: SAMMY winner, trumpet player Nick Frenay to perform with Josh Groban | syracuse.com

author: Melinda Johnson | mjohnson@syracuse.com
title: SAMMY winner, trumpet player Nick Frenay to perform with Josh Groban
text:
SYRACUSE, N.Y. â€“ Nick Frenay , a Central New York native, has been tapped to perform with pop singer Josh Groban in Providence, R.I. The trumpet player, the son of well-known guitarist Gary Frenay and Jackie Frenay, will play for the 8 p.m. show Friday at the Providence Performing Arts Center.
The recent graduate of the Berklee School of Music in Boston won a 2015 SAMMY (Syracuse Area Music Award) in the Best Pop category for his jazz-pop duo, Nick & Noah.
Frenay is one of three musicians from Central New York to join Groban at different stops on his nationwide tour. Baldwinsville high school student and trumpet player Aaron Dubois plays for the singer Albany, Syracuse and Buffalo shows this month. Drummer and Syracuse native Kevin Dean has performed with Groban in Washington, D.C., and Philadelphia and will again be at the shows in Albany, Syracuse and Buffalo.
Groban will perform at 7:30 p.m. Tuesday at the Landmark Theatre in Syracuse. The Albany show is at 8 p.m. Saturday at the Palace Theatre and 7:30 p.m. Wednesday at Buffalo's Shea's Performing Arts Center.
Watch Nick Frenay play the trumpet and talk about music.
